thread.title: Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash
thread.title_full: Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash

author: JUSTIN JUOZAPAVICIUS
title: Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash
text:
Sarah Phipps Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
Oklahoma State students Kelly Cooke, right, and Rebecca Buchanan read messages on a memorial in Stillwater, Okla., Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, near where a car crashed into spectators during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade killing multiple and injuring several others. (Sarah Phipps/The Oklahoman via AP) LOCAL STATIONS OUT (KFOR, KOCO, KWTV, KOKH, KAUT OUT); LOCAL WEBSITES OUT; LOCAL PRINT OUT (EDMOND SUN OUT, OKLAHOMA GAZETTE OUT) TABLOIDS OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT David Bitton Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
Emergency personnel respond to the scene of an accident after a vehicle crashed into a crowd of spectators during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade, causing multiple injuries, on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 in Stillwater, Oka. (David Bitton/The News Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT HOGP Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
This photo provided by the Stillwater Police Department on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 shows Adacia Chambers. Police said Chambers plowed her car into a crowd of spectators Saturday during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade. (Stillwater Police Department via AP) Brody Schmidt Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
A damaged police motorcycle rests in the intersection after a vehicle crashed into a crowd of spectators during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade, causing multiple injuries, on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 in Stillwater, Oka.(AP Photo/Brody Schmidt) Brody Schmidt Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
Emergency personnel respond after a vehicle crashed into a crowd of spectators during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade, causing multiple injuries, on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 in Stillwater, Oka.(AP Photo/Brody Schmidt) Brody Schmidt Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
Police investigators look over the scene after a vehicle crashed into a crowd of spectators during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade, causing multiple injuries, on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 in Stillwater, Oka.(AP Photo/Brody Schmidt) HONS Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
This photo courtesy of Geoff Haxton, police investigate a damaged car after the vehicle crashed into a crowd of spectators during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade, causing multiple injuries, on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 in Stillwater, Oka. (courtesy of Geoff Haxton via AP Brody Schmidt Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
Police investigate a damaged car after the vehicle crashed into a crowd of spectators during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade, causing multiple injuries, on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 in Stillwater, Oka.(AP Photo/Brody Schmidt) David Bitton Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
Emergency personnel respond after a vehicle crashed into a crowd of spectators during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade, causing multiple injuries, on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 in Stillwater, Oka. (David Bitton/The News Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Brody Schmidt Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash 
Emergency personnel gather a vehicle crashed into a crowd of spectators during the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade, causing multiple injuries, on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 in Stillwater, Oka.(AP Photo/Brody Schmidt) Posted: Sunday, October 25, 2015 9:03 pm | Updated: 10:00 pm, Sun Oct 25, 2015. Woman faces 2nd-degree murder charges in parade crash Associated Press | 0 comments 
STILLWATER, Okla. (AP) â€” A woman faces second-degree murder charges after authorities said she plowed a car into the crowd at the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade, killing four people, including a toddler. 
Adacia Chambers, a 25-year-old resident of the college town, was arrested after the Saturday crash on a driving while under the influence charge, and Stillwater police announced Sunday she was being held on four additional counts of second-degree murder. kAm$E:==H2E6C A@=:46 5:5 ?@E 6=23@C2E6 @?
